entry.title: Rename FieldClassificationMatchesFillingProduct
entry.content:
Currently, whenever one makes any change to the histogram file, the git

secrets checker will complain that the following line matches a

prohibited pattern:




This forces you to commit with the --no-verify option.



The problem is that the git secret checker regex naively just looks for

key="(40 character string)". By renaming it to

ClassificationMatchesFillingProduct, the check no longer triggers.



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: I1c0f034f6a74904b047b522cd0d2840840fdd930

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5261822

Reviewed-by: Bruno Braga

entry.title: Add crash keys for scroll corner crash
entry.content:
This CL adds crash keys to record the type of LayoutObject when a hit

test hits a scroll corner but the hit test's hit node doesn't have a

ScrollableArea. Two crash keys are added to record the LayoutObject on

the ScrollableArea, at the time the scroll corner hit is recorded, and

the layout object that's being used to compute scrollbar style (which

comes from `HitTestResult.InnerPossiblyPseudoNode()`).



Bug: 1519197

Change-Id: I109f3dcd14aeb201b02a2fc39ece52bb7e156d05

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5259501

Commit-Queue: David Bokan

Reviewed-by: Dave Tapuska

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255557}

entry.title: Avoid CHECKing for missing scrollable area
entry.content:
It seems the node/layout_object returned from a hit test is sometimes

not the one we used to hit test a scrollable area. Not sure how this

happens but we should avoid crashing in this case and return null which

will just use style from the hit layout object to style a cursor (which

is what was done prior to https://crrev.com/a7b66a751c2ed55).



I'll add crash keys to debug this in a followup.



Bug: 1519197

Change-Id: I2afe75f9ce7287492bb5e80677b6dc3cb603582d

entry.title: [UNO] Show chrome sign in bubble if chrome isn't signed in
entry.content:
This CL changes the Chrome sign in bubble to always show it if:

- the user isn't signed to chrome

- and sign in is happening through the web



This changes from the previous behavior that the bubble will also be

shown on reauth and for secondary accounts.



This CL also changes the priority of recording

`ShouldShowChromeSigninBubbleWithReason`. It will be easier to

understand the data if we first exclude sign in that aren't happening

through the web. This will help exclude users that sign in through

chrome from the bucket `kShouldNotShowAlreadySignedIn`.



Bug: b/320426816

entry.title: [Gardening] Revert "Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e5f6f1434e631cd1c8154a41ee95ce6126688e9a.



Reason for revert: Appears to be causing content_browsertests

failures.



Original change's description:

> Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust

>

> See chromium:1508245 for context.

>

> - Decide whether crosapi is enabled based on the command line

> switches. In particular, make it independent of when/whether

> BrowserTestBase::SetUp gets called.

> We still provide DisableCrosapiForTesting for legacy reasons,

> as some tests need to ovrerride it.

>

> - This, plus some new checks, make it hard for tests

> * to accidentally and silently override the Ash-provided init

> params with mostly empty ones, or

> * to accidentally and silently prevent the Ash-provided params

> from even being read.

>

> - Address a TODO in InProcessBrowserTest thanks to these changes.

>

> - Call DisableCrosapiForTesting in ViewsTestBase-derived tests that

> run with crosapi enabled but are not prepared to set it up (and thus

> would fail one of the new checks) and in fact don't need crosapi.

>

> - Remove InProcessBrowserTest::IsCrosapiEnabled() in favor of

> !chromeos::BrowserParamsProxy::IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting(). There

> is no need to have the InProcessBrowserTest predicate and it's not

> an InProcessBrowserTest level concept.

>

> - Remove ScopedDisableCrosapiForTesting class, as there is no need for

> a scope. Tests should either not call DisableCrosapiForTesting at

> all or should do it very early on (CHECK'd). Undoing it is not

> supported and it's not neceesary because tests run in separate

> processes.

>

> - Add documentation to startup/README.md.

>

> - Remove some uses of IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting from production code

> that are no longer needed.

>

> Bug: chromium:1508245

> Change-Id: Id6b68a25dae4c50132f957f4b80879fdcde2e7b2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5076190

> Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

> Reviewed-by: Hidehiko Abe

> Commit-Queue: Georg Neis

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255430}



Bug: chromium:1508245

Change-Id: I2ca5826474269b6d3ecdfe20ec85adb96aaad555

No-Presubmit: true

No-Tree-Checks: true

No-Try: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5259906

Reviewed-by: Dave Tapuska

Commit-Queue: Ian Vollick

entry.title: Tentative fixes for null distiller callback
entry.content:
There has been evidence that Callback may be null and lead to crash

As this was never reproduced, add a check to gather more info.

This CL fixes 3 potential issues and add DWC for tracking.

- distillation called without callback

- concurrent distillation leading to second callback being called twice

- multiple navigations during distillations leading to callback to be called twice.





Bug: 1216307

entry.title: Generate values for synthesized nodes during FinalizeAfterImport.
entry.content:
During profile finalization, we now generate values for the tree's

synthesized nodes. Note that these values are generated regardless of

which kind of update was made on the tree values, whether it was tree

completion or gap filling of nodes.



The values for synthesized nodes are generated using i18n formatting

expressions.



Bug: 1516912

Change-Id: I74e6281576c75328b699e9090751d986591c7707

Commit-Queue: Norge Vizcay

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255531}

entry.title: Add synthesized nodes to the address model.
entry.content:
The CL includes synthesized nodes as part of the AddressComponent tree

building process. It also makes the synthesized nodes accessible in the

tree through GetNodeForType and includes them in the list of supported

(not storable) types.

entry.title: [sync] Clear gaia-keyed custom passphrase pref
entry.content:
A new gaia-keyed pref for custom passphrase was introduced in

crrev.com/c/5237310 for signed-in non-syncing users on all platforms.



This CL:

* updates KeepAccountSettingsPrefsOnlyForUsers to also clear the new

per-account passphrase pref.

* renames chrome_test_util::ResetSyncSelectedDataTypes to

ResetSyncAccountSettingsPrefs to better reflect its usage

* adds corresponding tests in SyncPrefs, SyncUserSettingsImpl, and

ManageSynSettings egtest.

* not related to this bug: remove unused check in

testAccountSettingsWithRemoteSignout.



Bug: 1471928

Change-Id: Id930b60534c9848175b5077f5157cf8b4246a41b

entry.title: Android: Fix crash caused by NOTREACHED() on ReadingListWillUpdateEntry
entry.content:
On all platforms except Android

DualReadingListModel::ReadingListWillUpdateEntry /

DualReadingListModel::ReadingListDidUpdateEntry

are expected to not be reached if

DualReadingListModel::suppress_observer_notifications_ is not true, this

is because those platforms are treating the readinglist models only

through the DualReadingListModel.



This is not the case on Android, on Android the local readinglist model

and the account readinglist model are treated separately.



Bug: 1522103

Change-Id: I7cabfe4891b5e8fa02f8ca72f3656989f993ea26

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5253158

Reviewed-by: Mikel Astiz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255520}

entry.title: [bookmarks] Write account bookmarks to disk (dedicated JSON file)
entry.content:
The new logic is guarded behind feature

syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage, disabled by default.



A second independent instance of BookmarkStorage, owned by the very

same BookmarkModel, is introduced in this patch to take care of

persisting account bookmarks to JSON (dedicated file).



The only difference between the two BookmarkStorage instances, besides

the output file path, is the set of permanent nodes that they use as

input when encoding the JSON file. To distinguish this behavior, a new

enum is introduced, as similar existing enums have slightly different

semantics.



Change-Id: Ifeb5cde3bb23de520d5fad24ca208ffb0662d8d1

entry.title: [UNO] Small fixes in `DiceWebSigninInterceptor`
entry.content:
- `OnInterceptionReadyToBeProcessed()` did an early check if the user

has declined profile creation. Some of the interception bubble might

have skipped due to that check even though they don't require the

creation of a new profile (e.g. Chrome sign in bubble)

- `ShouldEnforceEnterpriseProfileSeparation()` in case of a reauth, it

doesn't check if the account is managed and returns true if the

profile hasn't accepted management. This CL ensure that this doesn't

return true if the account is not managed.

- For managed sync users, the management consent is implicit. The

current code sets the profile management and cancels the interception.

It is more correct to set the bit and check if other type of

interception should apply. Note: There are other places where the

management bit is set for sync managed users. It is unclear if setting

this bit in the interception logic is needed.

- `GetHeuristicOutCome()` returns null if there potentially the account

is subject to interception and it couldn't decide based on the

available information. On `ShouldShowChromeSigninBubbleWithReason::

kShouldNotShowUnknownAccessPoint`, `GetHeuristicOutcome()` returns

null which gives the wrong impression that the access point might be

known later when interception is ready to be processed. This condition

is removed to simplify the code, remove confusion and potentially show

other bubbles if appropriate (e.g. save password).



Bug: b/320426816

Change-Id: I76cce42b9683f1d85141d318de0f6171b1ed81e6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5249007

Commit-Queue: Monica Basta

Auto-Submit: Monica Basta

Reviewed-by: Yann Dago

Reviewed-by: David Roger

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255504}

entry.title: Remove AutofillProfile::SaveAdditionalInfo()
entry.content:
The function is only calls MergeDataFrom and logs a metric

"ProfileActionOnFormSubmitted". SaveAdditionalInfo() is not called on

form submit though (this was pre-Kustodie), but during deduplication.



This CL removes SaveAdditionalInfo(), all tests for it and the metric.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Autofill.ProfileActionOnFormSubmitted]=Misleadingly

named (not emitted on submission, but on startup) and obsolete, since

explicit save dialogs were launched.

entry.title: WTF, heap: Eliminate IsTraceableInCollectionTrait
entry.content:
Replace IsTraceableInCollectionTrait with equivalent IsTraceable (and

IsWeak where needed).



For vectors, IsTraceableInCollectionTrait was always equivalent to

IsTraceable.

For hash tables, IsTraceableInCollectionTrait was equivalent to

IsTraceable && !IsWeak.

files.



This CL was generated by

$ sed -i 's/unique_renderer_id/renderer_id/g'

and then reverting all changes in string literals.



That is, this CL only affects the C++ code; the JavaScript and

TypeScript code as well as JSON objects are left unchanged.

entry.title: Revert^3 "device selection: Do not special case multi-node changes"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 164bedb06f33a54285aea3f81adcaf0544851a7c.



This is a partial revert.



Reason for revert: b/322250920: audio device changes after login/logout



Original change's description:

> Revert^2 "device selection: Do not special case multi-node changes"

>

> This reverts commit 1bdb8d0f4ef1ecb97551055ab72383b388cd9c03.

>

> Reason for revert:

> Reland with fix for MemorySanitizer: use-of-uninitialized-value.

> DeviceChanges::has_any_change_ must have explicit `= false`.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Revert "device selection: Do not special case multi-node changes"

> >

> > This reverts commit 1ce1705dae28d3d7f56182f66f731aa78292e3d5.

> >

> > Reason for revert:

> > Break tests:

> > https://ci.chromium.org/old/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/40053

> >

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > device selection: Do not special case multi-node changes

> > >

> > > Merge the logic of HandleHotPlugDevice and HandleNonHotplugNodesChange:

> > > When multiple audio devices are plugged, treat as if they are plugged

> > > one by one. The device selection algorithm is expected to handle

> > > scenarios like this well. This would also be more robust on reboots,

> > > where it is likely not all audio devices are probed at once and

> > > SwitchToPreviousActiveDeviceIfAvailable cannot work reliably.

> > >

> > > Test fixes:

> > > - The new algorithm expects the active device has the highest

> > > priority among all connected devices for restoration to work.

> > > Update SetupCrasAudioHandlerWithActiveNodeInPref to set the

> > > user priority.

> > > - Remove uses of kHeadphone. It is special cased to always be

> > > selected when plugged.

> > > - Explicitly set the active device in

> > > ChangeOutputVolumeFromNonChromeSourceNonActiveDevice.

> > >

> > > Bug: b:304834020

> > > Test: autoninja -C out/Default/ chromeos_unittests && out/Default/chromeos_unittests

entry.title: [Autofill] Pass location to DumpWithoutCrashingForDuplicateIds()
entry.content:
DumpWithoutCrashing() throttles dumps, with the default limit

being 1 per day. The throttling is relative to the location of

the dump.



This CL passes the location of the

DumpWithoutCrashingForDuplicateIds() call through to

DumpWithoutCrashing().



That way, VotesUploader dumps cannot drown other dumps.

entry.title: Reland "Implementing uncompressed chrome installer"
entry.content:

Original change's description:

> Implementing uncompressed chrome installer

>

> - setup.exe supports --uncompressed-archive, which specifies the path to

> an uncompressed chrome archive.

> - mini_installer.exe now supports extracting an uncompressed chrome

> archive and an uncompressed setup executable, and running setup.exe

> with `--uncompressed-archive` in this case.

> - create_installer_archive.py now supports generating a resource file

> for mini_installer with an uncompressed archive and setup via

> `--resource_file_path_uncompressed`.

> - a new //chrome/installer/mini_installer:mini_installer_uncompressed

> target is defined for non-debug builds when the

> developers who wish to build a mini_installer with uncompressed

entry.title: [LineBreaker] Remove parallel flow break tokens when rewinding floats
entry.content:
When crrev.com/c/5052124 started rewinding floats, its

associated parallel flow break tokens should also be reset,

but it didn't. This patch fixes it.



The 3 tests are for the same cause, but may produce different

crash points. The `1` and `2` variants are more minimized and

easier to understand, but they produce different symptoms than

the original case that they may not always spot this issue as

the code evolves.

entry.title: Adjust CSSSelectorList tracing
entry.content:
We're improving the clang plugin for blink gc so that it alerts on

untraced array of traceable objects. Due to other technical limitations

of the plugin, it is not able to deduce that first_selector_ is traced

from the current implementation of the Trace method. Specifically, it

needs to see that the field is accessed (the check can't peer into the

First() getter method). This CL adjusts the Trace method so that the

plugin can correctly "understand" it.

entry.title: Add separate Picker item view classes for emojis, symbols and emoticons.
entry.content:
Since emojis, symbols and emoticons will have quite different behaviour

and layout to other Picker items, add separate classes for each of these

item types (rather than just using a kSmallGridItem type of

PickerItemView).



We'll also keep emojis, symbols and emoticons as separate classes to

each other since they have slightly differently styling and we may want

to add features specific to each type later on (e.g. emoji variants).



As before, these items are displayed together in a grid. (Or rather,

just a single row for now but we will make it a grid in some followup.)

entry.content:
ScreenAI library cannot be used in MSAN browser tests since the binary

is not instrumented for memory sanitizer tests and

`ScreenAIServiceRouterTest` and `PDFOCRIntegrationTest` browser tests

are now disabled on MSAN.



A base pure virtual library wrapper class is added: `ScreenAILibraryWrapperBase`



The original library wrapper is instantiated from the base wrapper and

is renamed to:

A new wrapper class is added for tests and is called:

`ScreenAILibraryWrapperForTesting`.

This class will be completed in next CLs to receive pre-specified

results for service calls.



This CL does not change any behavior in production or non-MSAN tests.

entry.title: [css-nesting] Create invisible/signaling rules during parsing
entry.content:
This CL emits invisible rules and signaling rules (which were

introduced by CL:5201402 and follow-ups) during parsing,

in order to use-count two situations:



1. Instead of "shifting up" bare declarations within nested style

rules, can we generate wrapping rules "in-place"? [1]



To figure this out, we generate those would-be in-place

wrapping rules in ConsumeDeclarationList, except they are

marked as *invisible*, i.e. they participate until

the StyleCascade, but are dropped during that process.

In addition, those invisible rules are marked as *signaling*,

which means that they trigger a use counter if they have

some effect on the cascade.



The hope is that by adding these rules, and proving that

they don't have any effect, we can conclude that the change

is safe, because adding the invisible rules gave us the same

end result as before.



2. Can we change the effective specificity of the generated

&-rule wrappers? [2]



This is only relevant for nested grouping rules, like @media.

To measure if this is safe, we generate an additional invisible

wrapping rule (before the regular &-rule) with the new

specificity characteristics (in ConsumeRuleListOrNested-

DeclarationList). Additionally, we make the existing &-rule

signaling. Hopefully, we if we can show that the &-rule

has no effect on the end result if the (invisible) alternative

rule is present, we can conclude that it's safe to remove.



The two approaches in (1) and (2) kind of mirror each other:



- In (1), we add an invisible rule *after* the main rule,

hoping that the quiet rule has no effect.

- In (2), we add an invisible rule *before* the main rule,

hoping that the *main rule* has no effect.



Note that invisible/signaling rules are only emitted when parsing

bare declarations: the rule *parsed* by a call to insertRule

can contain invisible/signaling rules, but nothing special happens

for the insertion itself. In other words, inserting a rule with

CSSOM does not create invisible/signaling sibling rules.



Introducing signaling/invisible rules adds quite a bit of complexity

to the code, and negatively impacts performance. All code introduced

by CL:5201402 and its follow-ups are therefore planned to be removed

again some time during 2024.

entry.title: [Office upload] Dump state when the uploaded url has an unexpected host
entry.content:
The uploaded (to Drive) url is always expected to have a

"docs.google.com" host. But we have seen from the metrics that this is

not always the case as there are kUnexpectedAlternateUrlHost values

logged for the OfficeFilesUploadResult metric.



Dump the state with unique crash keys to determine what other hosts are

appearing. Leave a TODO(b/323452926) to remove this dumping once the

root case is found.



The query in go/crash would be:

```

EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM UNNEST(productdata) WHERE

key='OfficeUpload-UnexpectedHost') AND product_name="Chrome_ChromeOS"

```



Bug: b/322909593

Change-Id: Iea2f9d3b05470b93418106a3db4aab0494277c91

entry.title: [Emoji picker] Fix Polymer syntax issues
entry.content:
Context: https://crrev.com/c/5259339



There was a typo where [[ was not matched by ]] in a Polymer parameter, causing the expression to always evaluate as true because non-empty strings are truthy.



As a result, a separate issue went undetected. It seems that Polymer is unable to parse literals (such as true/false) in [[]] fields, only recognising method and field names.



A line has been rewritten to use one of the component fields directly, without the need to pass a boolean literal into a method.



Fixed: b:323448656

entry.content:
- Remove unused externs files

that were not moved as part of the original fork.

cr_elements. These are identical to the

ui/webui/resources/cr_elements externs files since they were forked

recently and externs files are almost never updated since they exist

only to support a handful of legacy Closure UIs. Temporarily, this

means some Ash code will use externs from ash/webui/common and

cr_elements from ui/webui/resources/, until the subsequent large

scale change lands.

This also reduces the changes required in a future large scale change

to migrate remaining Ash WebUIs to use the Ash cr_elements fork.

entry.title: De-templatize some functions in StyleCascade.
entry.content:
These were made into templates in e0129bea, with the idea that they

could handle both the streaming parser and the token ranges. However,

that patch also removed all uses of the token ranges (moving everything

related to resolving var()/env() to the streaming parser), so we can

just remove all support for token ranges.



It would actually be nice to have support for token ranges in CSS

Functions (when resolving function arguments), but that would require

having ResolveTokensInto() support both, and it is built around an

interface that doesn't exist for CSSParserTokenRange (e.g. Peek()),

so it's not really a good option anyway.

code base, most presentation latency metric tests just expect that the

metric is recorded, and does not attempt to bound it.

entry.title: Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust
entry.content:
See chromium:1508245 for context.



- Decide whether crosapi is enabled based on the command line

switches. In particular, make it independent of when/whether

BrowserTestBase::SetUp gets called.

We still provide DisableCrosapiForTesting for legacy reasons,

as some tests need to ovrerride it.



- This, plus some new checks, make it hard for tests

* to accidentally and silently override the Ash-provided init

params with mostly empty ones, or

* to accidentally and silently prevent the Ash-provided params

from even being read.



- Address a TODO in InProcessBrowserTest thanks to these changes.



- Call DisableCrosapiForTesting in ViewsTestBase-derived tests that

run with crosapi enabled but are not prepared to set it up (and thus

would fail one of the new checks) and in fact don't need crosapi.



- Remove InProcessBrowserTest::IsCrosapiEnabled() in favor of

!chromeos::BrowserParamsProxy::IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting(). There

is no need to have the InProcessBrowserTest predicate and it's not

an InProcessBrowserTest level concept.



- Remove ScopedDisableCrosapiForTesting class, as there is no need for

a scope. Tests should either not call DisableCrosapiForTesting at

all or should do it very early on (CHECK'd). Undoing it is not

supported and it's not neceesary because tests run in separate

processes.



- Add documentation to startup/README.md.



- Remove some uses of IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting from production code

that are no longer needed.



Bug: chromium:1508245

Change-Id: Id6b68a25dae4c50132f957f4b80879fdcde2e7b2

entry.title: WebNN: Use CPU buffers for graph init and execution on UMA GPUs
entry.content:
For GPUs that support UMA (Unified Memory Architecture), e.g.,

integrated GPUs, the same physical memory pool (D3D12_MEMORY_POOL_L0) is

shared between CPU and GPU. Both processors can directly read and write

to the same physical memory addresses.



This CL adds the support of creating buffers in a custom heap with CPU

memory pool optimized for CPU uploading or reading back. For UMA GPUs,

this CL allows `dml::GraphImpl` to use these CPU buffers for passing

data between CPU and GPU as well as being bound as graph execution input

and output. This change eliminates the usage of separate upload/readback

buffers and input/output default buffers, and avoids the extra data

copies between them if the underlying D3D12 device supports UMA.



This CL also extends `WebNNCommandRecorderTest` with CPU buffers for

graph initialization and execution.





Bug: 1490856,1273291

Change-Id: I02bfc5119c73b78725686273576d31af22fa21e6

entry.title: CopyEI2T: Support HTMLImageElement Redecoded Mechanism
entry.content:
Uploading HTMLImageElement through CopyEI2T may have cases which

requires different alphaType, color space or other configurations.



Previous copyEI2T tries to use self provided algorithm to handle

these transformation. But in some cases, it fails to do correct

transformation due to origin info lost in image decode progress.



This CL add a redecoded mechanism for HTMLImageElement to handle

these difference through a redecoded step. This ensure no source

info missing and reduce loss due to multiple transformation steps.



Bug: chromium:1514809

Change-Id: Ib88c596eea4a1c8f10110b5ecd2e5fb686a14342

entry.title: [exo] Handle early display-activation events
entry.content:
Currently Exo / OutputController track display configuration changes

via their DisplayManager observation.



However the ordering in which DisplayManager notifies observers is

not well defined and should not be relied on.



This CL addresses a CHECK expectation crash that can occur if

DisplayManager observers propagate display-activation-changes in

response to display config changes - before Exo / OutputController

have had the chance to update output state.



Specifically, the crash in the linked bug occurs when a new

display was added - and the OutputController was asked to activate

the new display before the output object for the new display had

been created.



This CL slightly refactors existing unittests and adds a controller

test API to keep testing methods separate from the controller class.



Bug: b/323403137

Change-Id: I69c640ffc37a5bbff3073421f815226fdaf2212c

entry.title: Revert "[VCN] Update the navigation bar title text"
entry.content:
This reverts commit af219e63f67f3beb701fa31b7943e651b5a1d5de.



Reason for revert: causes test failures on iOS bots:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ios-simulator-full-configs/52739/overview

entry.title: MessagePumpEpoll: Begin native work batch on active events
entry.content:
The Delegate in the native work batch assumes another `DoWork()` call

before sleep. Starting native work batch based on epoll events without

active watchers could skip `DoWork()`, causing unexpected behavior. This

CL ensures `BeginNativeWorkBeforeDoWork()` is called only on active

epoll events, and prevents duplicate calls until the next `DoWork()`.



Bug: 1522731, 1500295

entry.title: [IP Protection] Tunnel HTTP requests over QUIC proxies
entry.content:
This CL makes proxied HTTP requests over QUIC proxies use CONNECT

tunnels instead of sending requests with the full URL to the proxy

directly. Support for configuring QUIC proxies other than for IP

Protection is being removed for now, and usage was already very low,

so this change is not expected to cause additional breakage.



This change obviates the need to fix a potential issue

identified in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5205530/comment/678af427_eedba0ef/

where for the proxied GET requests sent to the proxy server,

HttpStreamFactory::Job::DoInitConnectionImplQuic uses

QuicSessionRequests with the destination corresponding to the

proxy server but HttpStreamFactory::Job::HasAvailableQuicSession

looks for existing QuicSessions where the destination

corresponds to the request URL.



This aligns the QUIC HTTP proxying behavior with what's

implemented for HTTP/SPDY proxying when multi-proxy chains are

in use (see:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5085087)



Bug: 1520929

Change-Id: I1cebb46b36cecb1ef940e498563a3b052ff71b41

entry.title: Handle the case when EssentialSearchEnabled policy is re-disabled.
entry.content:
When the EssentialSearchEnabled policy is re-disabled, we want to give

the user the opportunity to explicitly choose whether they want to

accept or reject non-essential cookies and data.

To achieve this, the SOCS cookie is deleted upon EssentialSearchEnabled policy disablement. This will trigger the consent bump when using Google

search, prompting the user to accept or reject the usage of non-

essential cookies and data.

entry.title: Minimize audio pops when resampling
entry.content:
This CL removes audio pops when going back and forth between a playback

rate of ~1.0 and other playback rates, when preservesPitch=false.



When we repeatedly start and stop resampling, a small amount of residual

data is lost. This causes a discontinuity in the output signal, and thus

a small pop.



To fix this, always resample when preservesPitch=false. This comes at a

small performance/memory cost, and might be revisited if it causes any

measurable regressions.



Note: when `preservesPitch=true` (the default case), we use a WSOLA

algorithm instead, and there are known audio pops when transitioning to

and from playback rates of ~1.0. Smoothing those pops is significantly

more complex, and has not been attempted yet.



Bug: 1492404

Change-Id: Ibcd189d4c16d4d17cd4fb4f02506f00abf9ae215

entry.title: WebGL DrawingBuffer use SharedImage without GMB
entry.content:
This is to prepare for enabling low latency canvas on android where

GMB to SI is not supported, and SI by itself is enough.



Main change in DrawingBuffer that switches to using SI without GMB.

New behavior here is guarded by kDrawingBufferWithoutGpuMemoryBuffer.



This change affects cros/lacros and mac.



For cros/lacros, it's important the original gfx::BufferUsage set

by DrawingBuffer matches exactly the result of GetBufferUsage in

OzoneImageBackingFactory. Needed not drop SCANOUT in DrawingBuffer

to achieve this. Also remove kOzoneFrontBufferUsage kill switch to

avoid complicating the logic here.



Mac does not use gfx::BufferUsage for GMB allocation, so switching to

IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory is straightforward.



Note SI creation is not synchronous, so there is no fallback to

to non-overlay path (created_mappable_si is false) anymore on failure.



Clean up left over ScopedRGBEmulationForBlitFramebuffer class that's

not defined or used.



cros bots that runs Pixel_CanvasLowLatency* test still pass

and checked logging to ensure the correct SI factory

successfully allocated the SI.



Test: PS11 added debug logging and checked extra gpu-fyi mac and

Bug: 1500280, 924198
